Data: Rashid to Smith, 1 run touch short, whipped out to deep midwicket
Rashid to Finch, 2 wide angled down the leg side, he goes for a dab-sweep, doesn't make contact, rebounds off Buttler's gloves
Rashid to Smith, 1 run short again, pulled to deep backward square leg
Rashid to Finch, 1 run uses his feet, this drifts outside leg stump, pushed into the on side
Rashid to Smith, no run short on leg stump, think Smith was trying to leave this for the wide but it takes his body
Rashid to Smith, 1 wide this one is way down the leg side

Rashid to Smith, OUT he's got Smith! What a strike for Rashid. Gets it outside off, just a hint of turn, and a thin nick to Buttler. He actually played outside this, away from his body, and got an inside edge. Not sure Buttler took it entirely cleanly,
Rashid to Head, no run beats him straightaway! Adjust to the left hander, pushed across him, may have been the googly, Head's feet not going and he fiddles at it
Plunkett to Finch, 2 runs short of a length outside off, cut through point wide of third man
Plunkett to Finch, no run full outside off, onto the front foot and punches to cover
Plunkett to Finch, FOUR runs that's a lovely stroke, picks up a short-of-a-length delivery and plays a short-arm jab/pull shot over midwicket
Plunkett to Finch, FOUR runs edged! Through the vacant slip cordon. A good length ball outside off, it wasn't a deliberate glide from Finch
Plunkett to Finch, no run touch of extra bounce outside off, jabbed into the off side
Plunkett to Finch, no run back of a length outside off, played to cover
Rashid to Head, 1 run flicks a full toss down to long-on
Rashid to Finch, 2 runs down the leg side again, Finch gets a tickle on it fine of the keeper
Rashid to Finch, no run very full, wide outside off, mistimed back to the bowler off the toe end
Rashid to Finch, 1 run that's a bit of a heave...a full delivery outside off, swung through midwicket
Rashid to Head, no run full at middle and off, tucked to midwicket
Rashid to Head, FOUR runs full outside off, that's a strong shot from Head as he reaches out and drives between cover and mid-off
Plunkett to Finch, no run beaten outside off as he aims to drive on the up
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run width outside off, he throws his hands through a drive which lobs in the air over the infield to the sweeper
Plunkett to Head, no run back of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to cover
Plunkett to Head, no run very full outside off, 136kph/84mph, driven to mid-off
Plunkett to Head, no run pulls the length back, at off stump, defended to the bowler
Plunkett to Head, 1 wide down the leg side

Plunkett to Head, OUT dragged on! We saw a few of those in the Test match here. Good length, outside off, aiming to play square through the off side and gets a bottom edge into the timber. The seventh ball of the over proves a bonus for England!
Rashid to Finch, no run outside leg stump, the line has been inconsistent so far, flicked to short fine leg

Rashid to Finch, 1 leg bye huge appeal for lbw! Not sure he picked the googly. Morgan has called the review. Gets forward, spins past the bat and front pad. Actually takes the back leg. And it's done too much, missing leg stump
Rashid to Marsh, no run full and straight, defended on the front foot
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run more air, tossed up at off stump, punched firmly to mid-on who makes a good save but is deep enough for the single
Rashid to Finch, no run a little shorter, played off the back foot, gets an inside edge into his boot
Rashid to Finch, no run full outside off, driven firmly to cover
Plunkett to Marsh, no run short of a length outside off, driven square to point where it's smartly intercepted
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run short, he plays back, a defensive shot runs into the leg side
Plunkett to Finch, 1 leg bye angled into the pads, doesn't get any bat on it as he looks to flick and it bobbles behind square
Plunkett to Marsh, FOUR runs short delivery, at the body, deflects off the glove wide of the keeper...he was trying to get out of the way of that.
Plunkett to Marsh, no run back outside off, short of a length, pushed to point
Plunkett to Marsh, 2 runs full at leg stump, sweetly timed through the leg side, deep square gets across
Rashid to Finch, no run full length, outside off, dabbed to gully
Rashid to Finch, FOUR runs tossed up and sublimely swatted through square leg! Plants the front foot, sweeps with authority and that was nailed
Rashid to Finch, 1 run outside off, cut firmly into the off side
Rashid to Marsh, no run tossed up, under the eyeline, driven carefully to mid-off
Rashid to Marsh, no run a decent legspinner on middle and off. A solitary slip is still in attendance
Rashid to Marsh, no run forward and patted to cover
Ali to Finch, no run tucked to the leg side, back in the crease
Ali to Finch, 2 runs slices a cut through backward point
Ali to Finch, 1 run nurdled round the front pad, out to backward square
Ali to Marsh, no run forward and this one turns a touch to beat the edge. Tight line
Ali to Marsh, 1 run tapped into space, down the ground
Ali to Finch, 1 run flicked in the air, through midwicket, and up comes an effortlessly fluent fifty for Aaron Finch. It's been tough going out there, but he's made it look easy
Rashid to Finch, SIX runs smashed up and over long-on! Not really timed, nor to the pitch of the ball. But all levers and power!
Rashid to Finch, no run forward, poked back down the pitch
Rashid to Finch, 1 run tapped down the ground to long-on
Rashid to Marsh, no run worked into the covers
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run worked into the gap on the off side
Rashid to Finch, no run firmly swept, but well intercepted on the 45
Ali to Marsh, no run forward and punched to the off side
Ali to Marsh, no run short cover in business once again as Marsh looks to work the single through the off side
Ali to Marsh, no run on the back foot, mid-on gathers to join the dots
Ali to Marsh, 1 run high-elbowed push down to long-off
Ali to Finch, no run twirly length, on off stump
Ali to Finch, 2 runs pre-meditated retreat to leg, to free up the off side with a hefty calve. Not entirely timed, but placed well enough to return for the second
Plunkett to Marsh, no run smashing drive, but smashed straight to mid-off. Very full length, inviting the stroke
Plunkett to Marsh, no run back of a length this time, jabbed out to point
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run driven in the air, but just out of reach of short cover! Looked like a slower ball, and nearly did the trick
Plunkett to Finch, 1 wide slides down leg
Plunkett to Finch, no run on the back foot, defended back to the bowler
Plunkett to Finch, no run nudged to the leg side
Plunkett to Finch, no run pops up a touch into the leg side, but always safe
Ali to Marsh, 1 run punched back past the bowler
Ali to Finch, 1 run a patient poke into the off side, treating Moeen with respect
Ali to Marsh, no run blocked under the eye-line, Moeen gathers
Ali to Marsh, 1 run chopped into space at point
Ali to Finch, 1 run low full toss and dropped! That was pounded straight back at Moeen, who barely had time to react. Four runs (and the umpire) saved
Ali to Marsh, no run onto the front foot once more

Plunkett to Finch, no run angled into the pads, half an appeal from Plunkett, but the real drama is between the wickets - Marsh wants the single, gets sent back, and wears a shy on his back as he makes his ground
Plunkett to Finch, no run squared up on the back foot
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run slower ball, on the pads, tucked square
Plunkett to Marsh, no run short and sharp, a swishing pull finds nothing but air
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run defended on the back foot, a sharply taken single to mid-on
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run flicked off the toes, out to backward square leg
Ali to Finch, no run nurdled off the front pad
Ali to Finch, 1 run tucked to the leg side
Ali to Marsh, no run back and across, punched into the covers
Ali to Marsh, SIX runs panned into the stands! Tossed up, Marsh's eyes light up, aims dead straight, with a full swing of the bat, clean over the bowler's head and onto the sightscreen
Ali to Marsh, no run stabbed to cover
Ali to Marsh, no run worked back to the bowler
Woakes to Finch, no run tucked off the pads to leg
Woakes to Finch, 1 run short again, a rolled pull out to square leg
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run on the back foot, a decent leg-sided lifter, and a stolen run as Woakes pursues to gather
Woakes to Finch, FOUR runs back of a length, and battered through midwicket! Stunning timing, but Woakes' length is not right for his pace today
Woakes to Finch, no run chopped out to point
Woakes to Finch, 1 run on the pads, nudged to the leg side
Ali to Finch, no run looped up, on off stump. Blocked
Ali to Finch, no run retreats to leg to flog through the off side, but short cover gathers
Ali to Finch, no run flicked off the hip to short backward square
Ali to Finch, no run more spin, cracked to Morgan at short cover, who gathered in one movement and so nearly pulled off the shy! Marsh dives for safety
Ali to Finch, 1 run defended into the gap
Ali to Marsh, 1 run high elbow, tight line, good tidy over
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run sliding into the pads, deflected into space on the leg side
Woakes to Finch, 1 run on the back foot, nudged into the leg side
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run rolled wrists, down to third man
Woakes to Finch, FOUR runs terrible line from Woakes, full length, aiming down the leg side, and helped on its way with a casual flick
Woakes to Finch, 1 run back of a length, fenced through the vacant cordon to third man
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run onto the front foot, blocked to cover
Ali to Marsh, no run on the back foot, gathered well with a dive at mid-on
Ali to Marsh, 1 run whittled down to long-on for another single
Ali to Finch, 1 run blocked into the leg side
Ali to Marsh, 1 run another deflection into the leg side
Ali to Finch, 1 run spanked hard and long, into the leg side, but the sweeper tidies up
Ali to Marsh, no run tucked to leg again but another sharp tumbling stop at mid-on. A decent over in the end
Rashid to Finch, FOUR runs swept, and nailed. Too straight, and dabbed fiercely through backward square
Rashid to Finch, 1 run on the pads again, and another good single as short midwicket swoops
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run short, and carved to deep point
Rashid to Finch, 1 run on the legs, nudged behind square
Rashid to Marsh, no run looped up on off stump, and blocked
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run chiselled down to long-on, a good recovery from Rashid after a first-ball four
Ali to Marsh, 1 run nudged into space
Ali to Finch, 2 runs flicked off the front pad, another couple through the leg side
Ali to Finch, 1 run worked to leg once more
Ali to Marsh, 1 run eased through long-on for another single
Ali to Finch, 1 run milking it through the leg side once again
Ali to Marsh, 1 run gentle turn into the pads, Australia content to settle for the singles right now
Rashid to Marsh, SIX runs as if to prove the point, the first ball of the last 20 overs is a massive tonk, flat over midwicket! Lots of bottom hand, and general humpty, to greet a half-tracker
Rashid to Marsh, no run stretching forward, blocked on the front foot
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run flicked through the leg side
Rashid to Finch, SIX runs panned once more! Looped up, dipped late, Finch danced into position, and pongoed through the line of the ball, over long-on!
Rashid to Finch, no run on the back foot, quicker and flatter, and poked to cover
Rashid to Finch, no run swept hard, but backward square makes it two dots in a row, which helps rescue an expensive over
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed to the off side
Ali to Finch, no run huge appeal but England have no reviews! Looked like a bottom edge, but actually was the pad flap. A good decision
Ali to Finch, 1 run nurdled to the leg side
Ali to Marsh, 1 run makes room, and cuts into the covers
Ali to Finch, no run shorter, helped round the corner with a cross bat, but short backward square is in business again
Ali to Finch, 1 run keeps the strike with another nudge to leg
Rashid to Finch, no run tossed up and blocked on the front foot
Rashid to Finch, SIX runs pounded into the stands for his ninth ODI hundred! Right in the slot for a bottom-handed biff, high and mighty over wide long-on! Tremendous power and a mighty innings
Rashid to Finch, 1 run nudged to leg
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run worked round the front pad, behind square
Rashid to Finch, 1 run clipped off the pads to the leg side
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs crunched down the ground! No footwork, who needs any when the bat is swinging that freely! Australia are on the march now...
Ali to Finch, 1 run clubbed into the leg side, not entirely timed
Ali to Marsh, no run pushed to mid-on, off the back foot
Ali to Marsh, no run clipped through leg once more
Ali to Marsh, no run stands firm on the back foot to punch into the covers
Ali to Marsh, no run
Ali to Marsh, no run solidly into line to block, that's a tidy over
Wood to Finch, 1 leg bye back of a length, takes the thigh pad to the leg side
Wood to Marsh, no run well bowled, nips back from a good length, defended to the off side
Wood to Marsh, no run straight, on a good length at 140kph, played back to the bowler
Wood to Marsh, 1 leg bye another good one, angles back considerably from outside off, short of a length, beats Marsh for pace and takes him high on the back leg...deflects towards backward point
Wood to Finch, 1 run a short ball is compactly pulled to long leg
Wood to Marsh, no run a bouncer, over middle and off, 143kph/88mph, Marsh sways out of the line...good comeback over from Wood
Ali to Finch, no run backs away alongside leg stump to open up the off side, then misses
Ali to Finch, OUT picks out deep midwicket! Stands still this time, opts for the leg side, heaves across the line and clubs it down the throat of Bairstow
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run works a straighter delivery off the pads to the leg side
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushes a shorter delivery straight of midwicket
Ali to Stoinis, no run full at off stump, defended on the front foot to cover
Ali to Stoinis, no run good end for Moeen, full outside off, blocked to cover
Wood to Marsh, 1 run wide on the crease again, speared in at the stumps on a full length, squeezed into the leg side
Wood to Stoinis, no run well bowled, delivered from mid-crease, short at off stump at 143kph, jumps and defends down by his feet
Wood to Stoinis, FOUR runs just gets the line wrong this time, short on the hip, pulled fine of long leg...brings up Australia's 200
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run fuller, worked into square leg
Wood to Marsh, no run some late shape in at Marsh, full at off stump, driven to mid-off
Wood to Marsh, 1 run good length at off stump, pushed into the point area and takes him to a 66-ball fifty
Rashid to Marsh, no run out of the front of the hand, full and straight, pushed to midwicket
Rashid to Marsh, OUT through him! Nicely done from Rashid. Another one that goes straight on, Marsh giving himself a touch of room, misses the drive and the ball tickles leg stump
Rashid to Paine, no run full at middle and leg, comes forward and defends
Rashid to Paine, 1 run driven into the covers
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run tossed up, a googly, driven off the inside half of the bat to the leg side
Rashid to Paine, no run and this one isn't far from being dragged on, wider outside off, Paine aiming to drive through the covers and gets a bottom edge
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length, straight, nudged into the leg side
Woakes to Paine, 1 run back of a length, outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
Woakes to Stoinis, no run short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
Woakes to Stoinis, 2 runs fuller, at the pads, clipped through square and placed nicely between deep square and long leg
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run fuller outside off, pushed into the covers
Woakes to Paine, no run pushed square towards point and can't find the gap this time
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run gets down early and sweeps a full delivery off the stumps to long leg
Rashid to Paine, no run another wrong 'un, Paine prods forward with uncertainty
Rashid to Paine, 1 run opens the face and pushes square into the off side
Rashid to Stoinis, SIX runs uses his feet, makes it into a full toss and swings it over wide long-on...he has such power
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run back outside off, drives to deep cover
Rashid to Paine, no run full at leg stump, nudged to midwicket
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run short of a length, gets inside the line and pushed square on the leg side
Woakes to Paine, 1 run short of a length outside off, angled to third man
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run full, wide outside off, he goes for the drive and it skews in the air for a while but safely down to third man
Woakes to Paine, 1 run short, angling down the leg side, pulled to long leg
Woakes to Stoinis, no run full outside off, a slower ball, tapped towards point and Stoinis wanted the run but he was quickly sent back
Woakes to Stoinis, no run good length at off stump, pushed to the on side and Woakes fields it himself
Wood to Paine, 1 run back of a length at off stump, dropped into backward point
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run hops across the crease and takes this from well outside off to deep square
Wood to Paine, no run full outside off, driven firmly to cover
Wood to Paine, no run some late swing in, full at the stumps, driven back to the bowler
Wood to Paine, no run and now a short one outside off at 142kph/88mph, beats the top edge as Stoinis tries to go up and over
Wood to Paine, FOUR runs top shot! Excellent piece of timing and placement, gets forward into a full delivery outside off and drives it perfectly between cover and mid-off
Plunkett to Stoinis, 2 runs some width outside off, cut over backward point and wide of third man
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run short of a length, straight, pushed down the ground to long-on

Plunkett to Paine, 1 run full outside off, driven very firmly back at Plunkett who takes most of the pace of it but no one can stop the single as the ball scuttles behind him...well, well it got back to Plunkett on the full so technically a drop
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run a slower ball outside off, a big wind up from Stoinis and he's beaten by the change of pace
Plunkett to Stoinis, FOUR runs there's that power again, a fraction short from Plunkett, he sees the length so early and pulls over midwicket
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run full outside off, another slower one, driven into the covers

Wood to Stoinis, FOUR runs short outside off, and he's cut it over the off side almost for six! What a stroke that is. For a moment looked like he might pick out deep cover, but he placed it perfectly
Wood to Stoinis, no run short of a length, goes for the pull and gets an under edge into his crease
Wood to Stoinis, no run short of a length outside off, 142kph/88mph, he's across his crease and defends
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run a touch fuller but he again opts for the cross-batted shot, pulled without much timing to deep midwicket
Wood to Paine, 1 run short run up again...good length outside off, guided to third man
Wood to Stoinis, 2 runs a low full toss, full and straight, pushed through the leg side, splits long-on and deep midwicket
Plunkett to Stoinis, 2 runs goes over the off side, not quite out of the middle this time, lands short of the cover sweeper
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run good length, straight, drilled down to long-on
Plunkett to Paine, 1 run swings across the line of a back-of-a-length ball and finds deep square
Plunkett to Stoinis, FOUR runs low full toss on the pads and how's that for some whippage! Sends it rocketing behind square, no chance for the man in the deep, and that's a fantastic 37-ball fifty
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 wide a slower ball down the leg side, extra ball and extra run
Plunkett to Stoinis, SIX runs that's big! Gets underneath a full delivery, perhaps an attempted yorker, sends it straight down the ground over the sightscreen
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run goes for the yorker and this one is on target, driven down to long-on
Woakes to Stoinis, OUT finds mid-off! Back of a length, aiming to club it down the ground, doesn't get the elevation and Root grabs it coming forward
Woakes to Cummins, 1 run short of a length, takes an inside edge into the body and bobbles to the off side
Woakes to Paine, 1 run drags a back-of-a-length ball from outside off to long-on who does well to stop the second
Woakes to Cummins, no run beats him with a back-of-a-length slower delivery, he was aiming square through the off side
Woakes to Cummins, 1 run that's a big full toss, straight, pushed into the covers...below waist height, so not a no-ball

Woakes to Paine, no run he's move all around his crease here, looking for a scoop, Woakes cleverly fires it wide outside off...and excellent umpiring not to call that wide, have to give the bowlers something
Plunkett to Paine, 2 runs pulls a short ball between deep square and long leg...Australia's 250 up, can they find another 50?
Plunkett to Paine, FOUR runs a slower ball into the pitch, clubbed over wide mid-on and it scoots away from the chasing fielder
Plunkett to Paine, FOUR runs short again, and almost six! Gets the hook shot away, not completely in control, but places it between the two men in the deep
Plunkett to Paine, no run pushes the length up on off stump, Paine sends it back to the bowler
Plunkett to Paine, 1 run a slower ball, very slow at 98kph, short outside off, he manages to carve it out to deep cover
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run full, pushed with a straight bat down the ground
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run short of a length, nudged into midwicket, Woakes sets after it to make sure there isn't a second
Woakes to Paine, 1 run full outside off, a slower ball, angled to third man
Woakes to Stoinis, FOUR runs goes for the yorker, it's a low full toss and it's hammered straight of mid-off
Woakes to Stoinis, 2 runs short of a length outside off, square drives wide of the cover sweeper
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run full, wide outside off, driven to cover on the edge of the circle
Woakes to Paine, no run a short ball, Paine had started to come at the bowler, pulls to short fine leg and is annoyed at not finding the gap
Wood to Cummins, 2 runs gives himself room outside leg stump and then goes over the off side
Wood to Cummins, 1 run moves miles outside leg, Wood follows him, gives no room, and it's fended into backward point
Wood to Paine, 1 leg bye gets a bottom edge as he swings to the leg side, dribbles behind him through his legs...ah, not quite through the legs! Rebounds off a delicate area. Ouch
Wood to Cummins, 1 run short of a length, heaved through the leg side
Wood to Paine, 1 run short, pulled in the air towards fine leg, where Rashid doesn't judge it very well, doesn't start running forward to make the catch, but still stops the boundary
Wood to Cummins, 2 runs short again, crunched through the leg side, almost finds the gap but Hales does superbly to flick it back
Plunkett to Paine, no run swing a miss to the leg side, short of a length ball, last over starts with a dot

Plunkett to Paine, OUT well judged on the rope! As calm as you like from Moeen. A short ball, goes for the pull, gets a top edge, Moeen, at deep backward square, is in the shadows which are starting to come across the ground but knows exactly where the
Plunkett to Cummins, no run he's moving around the crease, and then fails to back contact with a back-of-a-length ball. Another dot
Plunkett to Cummins, FOUR runs that helps...gets a top edge as he swings across the line of a short delivery, goes straight back over the keeper. Takes Australia to 300

Plunkett to Cummins, OUT this is a long way up...and taken at long on. Jason Roy runs in, steadies himself, and makes no mistake. Cummins aiming to clear the leg side, got too much height and not enough distance

Plunkett to Tye, FOUR runs and he gets a boundary, because the fielder at deep midwicket committed to trying to make the catch! Heave into the deep, Bairstow went for the catch, the ball fell in front of him, then couldn't stop it

Australia have finished with 304. Which team will be happier? Reckon it's pretty even, although nothing scares England when it comes to chasing these days. A superb hundred from Finch, excellent hitting from Stoinis and a supporting fifty from Mitchell Marsh.

6.32pm Welcome back. England need 305 to win at the MCG, and lay down a significant marker in this five-match ODI series. No side has ever chased more than 300 at Melbourne, but England will fancy their chances with a power-packed line-up.
Starc to Roy, no run defended into the leg side
Starc to Roy, no run fully into line and blocked back down the pitch

Starc to Roy, SIX runs short, and a steepling top-edge, high and mighty over the keeper's head! Plops onto the sightscreen, and though the runs keep flowing, Australia aren't unhappy to see Roy beaten for pace
Starc to Roy, FOUR runs on the pads, too straight, flicked fine. He's flying!
Starc to Roy, FOUR runs panned over the covers! Leaning into the stroke, flogging the hands through the line, another stunning strike
Starc to Roy, no run punched straight to mid-off this time. And breathe
Cummins to Bairstow, 1 run tucked into the leg side
Cummins to Roy, SIX runs short, leg sided, and swatted over fine leg with the nonchalence of a cow flicking its tail at a fly!
Cummins to Roy, FOUR runs what utter timing! On the pads, clipped sweetly through the gap at midwicket, and it races all the way once more!
Cummins to Roy, no run tighter line, on the off stump, and Roy squares up to defend
Cummins to Roy, 3 runs too much width outside off, and Roy flogs on the up through the off side, not quite timed, but placed beyond the ring, so perfectly safe
Cummins to Bairstow, no run a swing and a miss! Shorter, wider, no contact this time
Starc to Roy, no run big appeal, but that looks to be going over as Roy is pinned on the line of leg stump
Starc to Roy, FOUR runs short-arm jab, back through the line of the ball. Pinged through mid-on with the rigid timing of a perfectly played table cricket shot
Starc to Roy, 1 wide short and wide, and called as such
Starc to Roy, 1 run beaten all ends up this time! But the ball rears from a good length, takes the splice, and loops safely into no-man's land behind gully!
Starc to Hales, no run cramped on the back foot, poked back down the pitch
Starc to Hales, FOUR runs short, and slapped through wide long-on as Hales instantly shows how he intends to play this one...
Cummins to Roy, no run stout defence on the front foot
Cummins to Roy, no run pushed into the covers, well fielded
Cummins to Roy, no run solid areas, outside off, and pushed back down the pitch
Cummins to Roy, 3 runs on the toes, clipped with sweet, sweet timing once more through the leg side, two men give chase and just about haul it back inside the rope

Cummins to Hales, OUT short, and a miscued pull, as Hales ducked into his pull as he realised he'd been beaten for pace. A simple catch pops up to short midwicket, and Australia are very much in the hunt now...
Cummins to Root, no run outside off, dabbed into the covers with a very straight bat
Starc to Roy, no run squared up on the leg stump, Roy stabs a drive back to the bowler
Starc to Roy, 2 runs on the pads and worked into the leg side
Starc to Roy, no run defended on the back foot, solidly into line
Starc to Roy, FOUR runs battered hard over long-on! Just a touch too short and pounded to keep his innings ticking
Starc to Roy, no run very full length, wide outside off and left alone
Starc to Roy, no run that is a punishing straight drive, but straight at the non-striker's stumps! Great shot for no reward
Cummins to Root, no run worked into the off side
Cummins to Root, no run good delivery, wide of off stump and exploding off the seam with good shape away from a loose drive
Cummins to Root, FOUR runs that's a crunching straight drive, using the pace, meeting it with a vertical bat, and all the way to the rope to get off the mark
Cummins to Root, no run on the toes and punched to cover
Cummins to Root, no run pushed into the cover
Cummins to Root, 2 runs on the toes, worked into the gap with a roll of the wrists
Tye to Roy, no run punched into the covers, off the back foot
Tye to Roy, no run good skiddy wicket-to-wicket fare, pushed into the off side again
Tye to Roy, no run blocked from a tight middle-and-leg line
Tye to Roy, no run outside off, through to the keeper, good aggressive pace

Tye to Roy, FOUR runs wanders across the stumps to manipulate an angle on Tye's probing line and length, another extraordinary stroke, timed once more through midwicket, and there's his fifty from 32 balls!
Tye to Roy, no run punched with lots of bottom hand to cover
Stoinis to Root, no run squared up on off stump and defended back down the pitch
Stoinis to Root, FOUR runs clipped firmly through square leg, and Root is picking up his tempo now. Placed ideally into the gap
Stoinis to Root, 2 runs clipped to the leg side
Stoinis to Root, 1 run jabbed through third man
Stoinis to Roy, no run short, outside off, through to the keeper
Stoinis to Roy, FOUR runs width, slashed, edged, four! A calculated risk on this occasion, no slips, so he needed only to get it past the keeper, which he most certainly did!
Tye to Root, 1 run tight line, back of a length, cut firmly to third man
Tye to Roy, no run good change-up from Tye, a slower ball that hops through to the keeper
Tye to Roy, 2 runs on the toes, worked round the corner
Tye to Roy, 1 run wafted into the leg side
Tye to Root, 1 run up onto the toes, punched to cover
Tye to Roy, 1 run whittled off the pads, into the leg side
Stoinis to Roy, no run wicket to wicket, drilled off the back foot to the bowler
Stoinis to Roy, no run flicked on the up, into the leg side
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run angled into the gully
Stoinis to Root, no run attempted yorker, well watched and dug into the leg side
Stoinis to Root, 1 run worked into the leg side
Stoinis to Roy, 2 runs short and hoisted behind square with a roll of the wrists
Tye to Root, 1 run stabbed down to third man
Tye to Roy, no run good full length, blocked back down the line of the ball
Tye to Roy, no run driven into the covers as Tye keeps his pace mixed up at all times
Tye to Roy, 1 run pumped straight, into space behind the bowler, and tidied up at mid-on
Tye to Root, no run opens the face in an attempted glide, but can't beat the cordon
Tye to Root, no run good chance of pace as Root is forced into a late adjustment on off stump
Stoinis to Roy, no run an ambitious wipe across the line as Stoinis bangs one in short. No contact
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run crashed into the covers, the hundred is up in rapid time
Stoinis to Root, 1 run width, and top-spin-slapped through the cordon to third man, always over the shot
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run flicked to the leg side
Stoinis to Root, no run slower ball, well watched, perfectly slapped, but straight into the non-striker's stumps for the second time today
Stoinis to Root, 1 run chiselled into the leg side
Tye to Root, 1 run worked into the gap
Tye to Roy, 1 run a short-arm pull through midwicket
Tye to Root, 1 run flicked into the leg side once more, another well placed stroke
Tye to Roy, no run dabbed out to cover
Tye to Roy, 2 runs speared into the toes, sweetly timed through backward square, but a good sliding stop in the deep cuts off the damage
Tye to Roy, no run crashed to cover
Zampa to Root, 2 runs on the legs, clipped calmly into space, and up comes the fifty stand
Zampa to Root, 1 run tossed up and defended to the leg side
Zampa to Roy, 1 run low full toss, clipped into space on the leg side
Zampa to Root, 1 run slower through the air, a touch loopier, dips into a leg-stump push
Zampa to Roy, 1 run clobbered out to cover
Zampa to Root, no run drawn down the track, and a late jabbed defensive block works its way to midwicket
Stoinis to Roy, 2 runs gets a little lucky here, splices a pull which loops over mid-on
Stoinis to Roy, no run back of a length at off stump, bunted back to the bowler
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run short outside off, angled to third man
Stoinis to Root, 1 run tucks a straight delivery off the pads through midwicket
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run short outside off, a flat-batted pull to deep square leg
Stoinis to Root, no run short of a length outside off, played to point
Zampa to Roy, no run defends a full ball back to the bowler
Zampa to Roy, 1 run opens the face and steers through the off side
Zampa to Root, 1 run plays back to a shorter delivery and pushes down the ground with a straight bat
Zampa to Roy, no run the googly, pushed into midwicket
Zampa to Roy, no run bunted to midwicket with a straight bat
Zampa to Roy, 1 run length on off stump, pushed to the cover sweeper
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run short, pulled to deep midwicket
Stoinis to Root, no run good length outside off, plays it late and it runs off the face towards the keeper
Stoinis to Root, no run hint of swing in at Root, played off the front foot back to the bowler
Stoinis to Root, 2 runs that's a nice piece of timing, leans forward into a length delivery and places it straight of mid-on
Stoinis to Root, 1 run banged in short, not quite out of the middle as Root pulls to deep midwicket
Stoinis to Roy, no run he's through the pull shot early this time, beaten on the under edge
Zampa to Root, 1 run deep in the crease, whips a straight delivery off the stumps to deep square leg
Zampa to Roy, no run loses his shape as he uses his feet and aims to whip this away, gets a think inside edge to short fine leg
Zampa to Roy, 1 run brings out the reverse sweep, loops square into the off side from a top edge...not sure that's needed
Zampa to Root, 1 run a nicely controlled drive down the ground
Zampa to Roy, 1 run full at off stump, swings across the line and gets a thick inside half of the bat to the leg side
Zampa to Root, no run plays back and pushes to midwicket
Cummins to Roy, FOUR runs nearly works! Short on leg stump, Roy goes for the pull and gets a top edge which flies just out of Paine's reach
Cummins to Roy, no run well bowled, another good bumper, Roy sways out of the line
Cummins to Roy, 2 runs that's gone high into the evening sky, and loops over mid-on then plugs in the outfield...a length delivery which Roy tried to send into the stands
Cummins to Roy, 1 run back of a length outside off, Roy adjusts and angles down to third man...he's ticking
Cummins to Root, no run short of a length outside off, a sweetly timed square cut but Smith pulls off a brilliant save at backward point
Cummins to Root, 1 run fuller at off stump, tucked into the leg side
Zampa to Root, no run full and straight, picks out midwicket
Zampa to Root, no run touch wider outside off, driven to cover
Zampa to Root, 1 run tossed up and comes out as a low full toss, costs just a single as Root drives to long-on
Zampa to Roy, 1 run strides forward and pushes a full delivery to long-on
Zampa to Root, no run dragged down a little short, Root goes onto his back knee and sweeps but finds short fine leg
Zampa to Root, 1 run the bottom hand comes into play as he shovels a full delivery to long-on
Cummins to Root, 1 run full outside off, pushes into the covers
Cummins to Roy, 2 leg byes angled into the pads, deflects behind square on the leg side off the pads and the lack of pace in the shot means they can scamper back for a second
Cummins to Roy, no run short and he connects cleanly with his pull but finds Marsh just in front of square
Cummins to Roy, 1 run touch of width outside off, drives on the up square to deep point
Cummins to Root, 1 run short at off stump, rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg
Cummins to Roy, no run tries to ramp this short delivery down to third man but is beaten by the bounce
Zampa to Root, 1 run tucked off the pads to deep square leg
Zampa to Roy, no run takes a skip down the pitch then flicks to midwicket
Zampa to Roy, 1 wide that comes out a little wrong, very wide outside off
Zampa to Roy, 1 run short of a length, pushed down the ground to long-on
Zampa to Root, 1 run steps back and drives to deep cover
Zampa to Roy, no run full at middle and leg, pushed firmly to midwicket
Zampa to Roy, 1 run nudged off the pads behind square on the leg side
Tye to Roy, 1 leg bye pushed into the pads, deflects wide of the keeper
Tye to Root, no run a slower ball, dug in, Root can only pull to midwicket
Tye to Root, 1 run another slower delivery, short outside off, angled down to third man
Tye to Roy, 2 runs he goes after this one, short of a length outside off, pulled high over midwicket but not timed especially well and stops on the outfield...came from high on the bat
Tye to Roy, no run good length at the stumps, defended into midwicket
Tye to Roy, no run good length, angled to backward point with an open face
Zampa to Root, 1 run a full toss outside off, Root opts for the leg side and slog-sweeps to deep midwicket without much timing

Zampa to Roy, no run he's done him with the googly! Given lbw. Lovely piece of bowling, but Roy is reviewing. Only thing that can save him is if he's hit outside the line. Impact is outside the line! He got his knee just far enough forward
Zampa to Roy, SIX runs just clears long-on! A dramatic few minutes...he uses his feet, opts for the aggressive route, launches it down the ground with just enough legs
Zampa to Roy, no run the slider, Roy not picking him, defended to cover
Zampa to Roy, no run nice bowling, nearly does him in length, defended to midwicket
Zampa to Roy, no run tossed up, dips late, almost a yorker and takes a thick inside edge into the boot...tension, tension. Zampa bowling very nicely
Tye to Root, no run full at off stump, 115kph slower ball, pushed to mid-on
Tye to Root, 1 run short of a length, drop-and-run into the leg side

Tye to Roy, 3 runs there's his hundred! Short outside off, he's across the crease and pulls through midwicket and it's enough for three figures. A super innings, electrifying in the first fifty and he's consolidated since
Tye to Root, no run good length outside off, driven to cover
Tye to Root, 1 run short of a length, straight, worked into the leg side
Tye to Roy, 1 run full at off stump, flicked to long-on
Zampa to Roy, FOUR runs full, straight, nails his reverse sweep this time, deep point can't get across
Zampa to Roy, 1 run full and straight, flicked wide of the diving midwicket
Zampa to Root, 1 run very full, dug out down the ground to long-on
Zampa to Roy, 1 run another googly, pitches wide outside off, dabbed to short third man
Zampa to Root, FOUR runs a full toss, a flat-batted swat along the ground through midwicket with the placement to beat the deep fielders
Zampa to Root, 1 run full and straight, pushed down the ground...an expensive over from Zampa
Starc to Root, 1 run full outside off, gets forward and drives to deep cover to reach a very controlled 59-ball fifty
Starc to Roy, 1 run good length, angled in at the stumps, tucked to the right of mid-on
Starc to Root, no run a slower ball, full outside off, opens the face and it's cut off at backward point
Starc to Root, no run right up at the toes, dug out to the covers
Starc to Root, no run chopped into the ground to backward point
Starc to Root, no run beats him a with a yorker, just wide of off stump, Root plays over the top of it...good comeback over from Starc
Marsh to Roy, no run swing and a miss! Good length outside off, Roy aims to go down the ground
Marsh to Roy, 1 run back of a length outside off, driven firmly just to the left of mid-off
Marsh to Root, no run full and straight, flicked to midwicket
Marsh to Root, 1 run full at off stump, a bottom-handed flick to mid-on
Marsh to Roy, FOUR runs bang! That's brute force from Roy, back of a length outside off, clubbed straight down the ground and long-on Finch, dives over the top of it
Marsh to Roy, 1 run skews off a thickish outside edge to deep cover
Starc to Roy, FOUR runs that's tough for Starc! Round the wicket, speared in full at leg stump, Roy gets an inside edge through his legs...the Nat-Meg?
Starc to Roy, no run that's a wild swing, short of a length outside off, Roy had his eyes on the stands at deep square
Starc to Roy, no run another short one, a slower ball, Roy spots it and bails out of any attempt to play...goes second bounce to Paine
Starc to Roy, no run fuller length, pushed to mid-on
Starc to Roy, no run short of a length, angled in at Roy, cramps him for room and loops back down the pitch towards Starc
Starc to Roy, 2 runs aims for the leg-stump yorker again, not a million miles, but it's clipped behind square and long leg can't stop the second
Marsh to Root, 1 run gets over the top of a short delivery and pulls to long leg
Marsh to Roy, no run that's through him, short, Roy going for a pull
Marsh to Roy, 1 run back of a length on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
Marsh to Root, 2 runs walks across the crease and flicks this from outside off to deep midwicket
Marsh to Root, 1 leg bye short of a length, he goes for a whip-pull, gets a bottom edge into the pads which loops through to Paine who makes a good stop but they steal the run...actually, no edge
Marsh to Roy, FOUR runs that's well played, not a great ball though with this field, short on leg stump and Roy pulls it over short fine leg
Starc to Root, no run stays round the wicket, back of a length at off stump, pushed to backward point
Starc to Root, 1 run gone with a hit! Gets behind a short ball, knocks into the off side, Smith fields from backward point and he would have been short
Starc to Roy, 1 run full at the stumps, heaved over the leg side, one bounce to deep square leg...runs required under 100
Starc to Root, 1 run full, angled in at the pads, clipped along the ground to deep midwicket
Starc to Roy, FOUR runs short outside off, Roy gets right across the crease and pulls strongly through midwicket...top placement
Starc to Roy, 1 run short again, another pulls, this time it's more a bottom edge that dribbles to deep square
Zampa to Roy, 3 runs back of a length, battered with alacrity out to deep midwicket, where the ball is well hauled back by a headlong dive towards the rope
Zampa to Root, 1 run clipped on the up through mid-on, an easy strike-manoeuvring single
Zampa to Roy, 2 runs hammered high and hard, out to deep midwicket... who's out there? No-one! The ball plugs safe and Roy marches on!
Zampa to Roy, no run bat and pad together, poking the googly out to gully, as Root scampers through ahead of the shy
Zampa to Roy, no run reverse-sweep, top-edged, but just short of gully.... he's living dangerously!
Zampa to Roy, SIX runs too short, hoisted and that's more handsome! Clean over the ropes at wide long-on, to end a probing over with a dismissive thwack!
Cummins to Root, no run tapped into the covers
Cummins to Root, 1 run on the toes, clipped to leg
Cummins to Roy, no run banged in short, a looping slower ball
Cummins to Roy, 2 runs pushed back into the crease, clipped to the leg side for another sharp single
Cummins to Roy, no run outside off, a swing and a miss
Cummins to Roy, 1 run crikey, Roy tries to drop his gloves on a lifter, finds the inside splice, and loops a curious backwards cut down to fine leg. They all count
Zampa to Roy, no run stretching forward to defend, pushed back down the pitch
Zampa to Roy, FOUR runs sliding down the leg side, a big swish distracts the keeper, and a thin bottom edge adds to the tallly
Zampa to Roy, no run a loose and wafty drive as Zampa dangles it outside off
Zampa to Roy, 2 runs and up comes the 150... barely acknowledged though, he's got bigger fish to fry
Zampa to Roy, no run another loose wipe, losing a bit of shape at this late stage of his innings
Zampa to Roy, 1 run hasty defence, kept out with a flurry of limbs, and another stolen single to leg side
Cummins to Roy, 1 run short, pulled, wrists rolling over the ball as the shot rolls out to deep square leg
Cummins to Root, 1 run up on the toes, punched to cover
Cummins to Roy, 1 run banged in short, out to deep midwicket
Cummins to Root, no run clipped on the up through mid-on
Cummins to Root, 1 run wide and glided through backward point
Cummins to Roy, no run bouncer, well directed, Roy walked right inside the line as the ball passed over the top of middle stump
Zampa to Root, FOUR runs twisting down the leg side, a rank half-tracker and helped round the corner with a languid pull
Zampa to Root, no run forward and pushed to the off side
Zampa to Root, no run dancing feet to defend
Zampa to Root, 1 run forward and pushed to the off side
Zampa to Roy, SIX runs high and mighty! Into the floodlights, down into the stands! Tossed up, tempting England's main man, and he was tempted alright!
Zampa to Roy, 2 runs tip and run into the covers, and what excellent running to turn one into two. He's matched his previous best against Sri Lanka at The Oval
Starc to Root, 1 run chiselled out to the leg side
Starc to Roy, 1 run low full toss, squeezed out to point, excellently grabbed at point and the shy hits the non-striker's stumps as Root scampers for the crease
Starc to Root, 1 run kneeling into a crunching front-foot drive, into the off side
Starc to Roy, FOUR runs short again, slammed again, up and over the leg side. He is monumentally in the zone!
Starc to Roy, 2 runs on the pads, tucked to the leg side, another scampered single
Starc to Roy, 1 run low full toss, squeezed out to point
Tye to Roy, 1 run back of a length, tapped to midwicket to draw level with Alex Hales as England's highest scorer in ODIs!
Tye to Root, 2 runs on the pads, whipped square and finds the gap with ease to jog back for the second
Tye to Root, 1 run full length, clipped to leg. Simple pickings
Tye to Roy, no run heave ho! Roy eyes up the massive mow but the line is a touch too wide. A big golf drive down an imaginary fairway
Tye to Roy, 2 runs battered on the up, just out of the reach of cover, and Roy is England's highest scorer in ODIs!
Tye to Roy, 1 leg bye worked to leg once more
Starc to Roy, no run round the wicket, attacking the blockhole, dug out to cover
Starc to Roy, 2 runs short, pulled, well stopped on the fine leg boundary with an opportune dive from Zampa
Starc to Roy, no run into line to defend
Starc to Roy, 1 run walking across the stumps, picks it up off middle and leg to flick another single to Zampa at fine leg
Starc to Root, 1 run forward, driven to cover
Starc to Roy, 1 run worked to leg once again, that's been a bread-and-butter single all innings long
Tye to Roy, no run outside off, very full, stabbed through third man
Tye to Roy, 1 run short and wide, cracked on the up but not timed. Matters not, as it plugs safe in the covers, well short of the boundary riders
Tye to Root, no run width, attempted square drive, nearly finds the edge!
Tye to Root, 2 runs low full toss, crunched into the gap, all along the ground. Easy as you like
Tye to Root, 1 run nudged off the legs
Tye to Roy, 1 run fewer bothers middling his drives though, another wristy tonk into the covers
Starc to Roy, 1 run tapped through mid-off and there's another well-judged single
Starc to Root, 1 run round the wicket, very full length, punched into the covers

Starc to Roy, OUT short, pulled, top-edged, gone! The end of a triumphant innings from Roy, the MCG rises as one to a brilliant performance. A bit of a tired ending, went for the big humpty over the leg side, but ended up with a lobbed chance to backwa
Starc to Root, no run full again, driven hard to point
Starc to Root, 1 run round the wicket, into the toes, another single to cover
Starc to Morgan, no run over the wicket, dabbed back down the track to welcome the new man, England's captain
Tye to Root, 1 run angled into the pads, clipped behind square to nibble ever closer to the target
Tye to Morgan, no run on the gallop, and misses with a mow outside off! Easy now...
Tye to Morgan, 1 run short and battered out through square leg
Tye to Root, no run fully into line to defend
Tye to Root, no run opens the face to defend out to point
Tye to Root, 1 run a hop-chop, out through backward point
Cummins to Root, no run hurried on a good length, defended on the back foot with one hand coming loose
Cummins to Root, 2 runs short and hoisted out to deep square leg
Cummins to Root, 1 run dabbed through third man, waiting for the ball to arrive
Cummins to Buttler, 1 wide banged in short, too short for the umpire's liking
Cummins to Buttler, no run short and thumps the gloves. Good aggression in adversity
Cummins to Buttler, no run tapped out to point. The patient still has a pulse
Tye to Root, 1 run tapped into the gap
Tye to Buttler, no run short and sharp, good intent from Tye, who is not going without a fight
Tye to Buttler, no run solidly into line
Tye to Buttler, 1 run thumped to the leg side
Tye to Root, no run outswinging slower-ball yorker. Not a bad nut to produce at the best of times. Beats Root all ends up outside off
Tye to Root, 1 run slower ball again, swings late, met with a compact drive to cover
Cummins to Root, 1 run another single, chipping the deficit away
Cummins to Buttler, no run lifting into the gloves, that's a sharp delivery, keeping England honest
Cummins to Buttler, 3 runs fuller length, picks the gap this time with a thumping drive, splitting the covers, and handing the strike back to the more settled Root
Cummins to Root, 1 run short and aggressive, targetting the head, but pulled down to backward square to keep the runs ticking
Cummins to Buttler, no run short and through to the keeper
Cummins to Buttler, no run short and sharp again, Australia defending this match with aggression and tenacity, but they are already several fathoms underwater
Stoinis to Root, no run cracked straight to cover
Stoinis to Root, FOUR runs in the arc, and tonked over the bowler to bring England to within a solitary boundary
Stoinis to Root, no run on the toes, that could have been it, but Finch at short midwicket wears the shot on his shin. Ouch
Stoinis to Root, 1 run outside off, dabbed into the off side for another sharp single
Stoinis to Root, no run drilled hard to cover. Another dot...
Head to Ali, no run nicely flighted, into the blockhole
Head to Ali, 1 run dabbed into the gap for a single
Head to Root, 1 run a bottom-handed bunt down to long-on, and the scores are level
Head to Ali, no run a yawning mow from Mo! Lucky not to lose his poles. Careful now
Head to Ali, FOUR runs battered through long-on, and England win by five wickets!

10.11pm England win with seven balls to spare on a memorable night at the MCG. A record innings, a first-ever chase of a 300-plus total by any side at Australia's grandest ground, and a vital calling-card from a one-day squad that has high expectations, and p
"Australia are a strong side and will come back incredibly hard at Brisbane, but it's a nice way to start the series."

10.25pm So, that sums things up from the first ODI. Have a read of Dan Brettig's match report before you go, and we'll see you at the Gabba for Match 2 out of 5 in what promises to be a high-octane ODI series.
England won by 5 wickets (with 7 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Jason Roy, ENG
